org.jtrim.image.transform

Class SerialImagePointTransformer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jtrim.image.transform.SerialImagePointTransformer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ImagePointTransformer

    public final class SerialImagePointTransformer
extends java.lang.Object
implements ImagePointTransformer
    Defines a coordinate transformation based on a list of other coordinate transformations. That is, this coordinate transformation simply applies the transformations in the order the transformations were specified at construction time.

    Thread safety

    Instances of this class are safe to be accessed from multiple threads concurrently.

    Synchronization transparency

    Methods of this interface are not synchronization transparent and calling them while holding a lock should be avoided.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SerialImagePointTransformer

        @Deprecated
public SerialImagePointTransformer(ImagePointTransformer... transformers)
        Deprecated. Use the factory method SerialImagePointTransformer.combine instead.

        Creates a new SerialImagePointTransformer from an array of coordinate transformations.

        Parameters:
        transformers - the coordinate transformations in the order they need to be applied. This argument cannot be null and cannot contain null elements. If this array is empty, the newly created SerialImagePointTransformer will be equivalent to the identity transformation.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the coordinate transformation array or any of its element is null

      • SerialImagePointTransformer

        @Deprecated
public SerialImagePointTransformer(java.util.List<? extends ImagePointTransformer> transformers)
        Deprecated. Use the factory method SerialImagePointTransformer.combine instead.

        Creates a new SerialImagePointTransformer from a list of coordinate transformations.

        Parameters:
        transformers - the coordinate transformations in the order they need to be applied. This argument cannot be null and cannot contain null elements. If this list is empty, the newly created SerialImagePointTransformer will be equivalent to the identity transformation.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the coordinate transformation list or any of its element is null

    • Method Detail

      • combine

        public static ImagePointTransformer combine(ImagePointTransformer... transformers)
        Returns a transformation equivalent to applying all the specified transformations in the given order.

        This method does not necessarily returns an instance of SerialImagePointTransformer. For example, if you specify only a single transformation, then that transformation is returned.

        Parameters:
        transformers - the coordinate transformations to be applied in the order they need to be applied. This argument cannot be null and cannot contain null elements. This argument can be an empty array, in which case an identity transformation is returned.
        Returns:
        a transformation equivalent to applying all the specified transformations in the given order. This method never returns null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified array or any of its element is null

      • combine

        public static ImagePointTransformer combine(java.util.List<? extends ImagePointTransformer> transformers)
        Returns a transformation equivalent to applying all the specified transformations in the given order.

        This method does not necessarily returns an instance of SerialImagePointTransformer. For example, if you specify only a single transformation, then that transformation is returned.

        Parameters:
        transformers - the coordinate transformations to be appied in the order they need to be applied. This argument cannot be null and cannot contain null elements. This argument can be an empty list, in which case an identity transformation is returned.
        Returns:
        a transformation equivalent to applying all the specified transformations in the given order. This method never returns null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified list or any of its element is null

      • transformSrcToDest

        public void transformSrcToDest(java.awt.geom.Point2D src,
                      java.awt.geom.Point2D dest)
        Transforms the given 2D point from the source coordinate system to the destination coordinate system.

        The source and destination point objects are allowed to be the same object.

        Implementation note: This method will simply call the transformSrcToDest method of the coordinate transformations in the order they were specified at construction time.

        Specified by:
        transformSrcToDest in interface ImagePointTransformer
        Parameters:
        src - the point to be transformed to the destination coordinate system. This argument cannot be null and this method is not allowed to modify this argument.
        dest - the point object where the result of the transformation is to be stored. This method modifies this argument. This argument cannot be null.

      • transformDestToSrc

        public void transformDestToSrc(java.awt.geom.Point2D dest,
                      java.awt.geom.Point2D src)
                        throws java.awt.geom.NoninvertibleTransformException
        Transforms the given 2D point from the destination coordinate system to the source coordinate system.

        The source and destination point objects are allowed to be the same object.

        This method is the inverse transformation of transformSrcToDest. Note however, that due to rounding errors, applying this method to a point created by transformSrcToDest may not yield exactly the same source point.

        Implementation note: This method will simply call the transformDestToSrc method of the coordinate transformations in the reverse order they were specified at construction time.

        Specified by:
        transformDestToSrc in interface ImagePointTransformer
        Parameters:
        dest - the point to be transformed to the source coordinate system. This argument cannot be null and this method is not allowed to modify this argument.
        src - the point object where the result of the transformation is to be stored. This method modifies this argument. This argument cannot be null.
        Throws:
        java.awt.geom.NoninvertibleTransformException - thrown if the transformation cannot be done because the source to destination transformation cannot be inverted
